availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jacob C. Bennett (Captain in the 10th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (C.S.A.))

body.p: Muhlenberg County, Kentucky, resident and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Washington Bennett and Indiana Bennett. Married to Fannie Bennett. Married to Martha P. Bennett. Resident of Muhlengerg County in 1850. Captain in the 10th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (C.S.A.) from August 1, 1862, to July 26, 1863. Prisoner of War at Camp Chase, Ohio. Transferred to Ohio Penitentiary on September 16, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County, Subdivision No. 2, p. 230A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Overton County, District 13, p. 392A.
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0056. Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, Tennessee, Tennessee Death Records, 1908-1959, Roll M-19 (accessed through Ancestry.com).
